result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra L. Weiler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No objection to transferring probation to State of Indiana.
Concurrent with: each other

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA and follow up.  

DNA sample.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rules violations.

Petition and Stipulation to Amend Judgment of Conviction Probation Cases

of Preliminary Examination
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  1:45 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CF447, 22CF534, 22CF621.
State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher for ADA Mayo. 
Defendant appears in person with Atty Shari Post. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing and waiver of prelim in all cases.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

22CF534/22CF621/22CF447>>
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed.  

Plea/Sentencing Hearing>>

22CF447>>State moves to DRI Count 1 (Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine/Repeater); Court grants. 

22CF534>>State moves to DRI Count 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater); Court grants. 

22CF621>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine)
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Felony)
Count 5 (Bail Jumping-Felony)
Court grants.  

PLEA: 

22CF534 Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

22CF621 Count 2 (Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine >3-10g)>>NO CONTEST.  
22CF621 Count 3 (Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine <=3g)>>NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on 22CF534:  23 days MCJ.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  Court grants 23 days credit.  

COURT ORDERS on both counts 22CF621:  SWH for 4 years probation; concurrent with each other.  CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  60 days MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  

No objection to transferring probation to State of Indiana. 

COURT notes surety has sent written letter requesting return of bond money on 22CF621; COURT makes findings and grants return of bond. 

Adj: 2:08 p.m.
